concepts.Summary: rules of computation - add define special form

concepts.Example code:
(define unit (square 50 "outline" "black"))
(define row (beside unit unit unit unit)) (above row row row row)

(require 2htdp/image)
(define circ-unit (circle 25
"outline" "black"))
(define circ-row
(beside circ-unit circ-unit
circ-unit circ-unit))
(above circ-row circ-row circ-row circ-row)

concepts.Summary:
(lambda (arg1 arg2 ... argn) exp)
(λ (arg1 arg2 ... argn) exp)
rules of computation - same as previous

concepts.Example code:
(define row
  (λ (unit)
   (beside unit unit unit unit)))
(define stack
  (λ (unit)
   (above unit unit unit unit)))
(define grid
  (λ (unit)
   (stack (row unit))))

(define square (λ (n) (* n n)))

(define polynomial
  (λ (n)
     (+ (square n) (* n 2)
        4)))

(define compose
  (λ (p1 p2)
    (λ (arg)
      (p1 (p2 arg)))))

(define square
  (λ (n)
    (* n n)))

(define f (compose square sin))

concepts.Summary: rules of computation - with define and lambda

concepts.Example code:
(define boxes (λ (count)
  (local [(define q (quotient 250 count))]
    (iterated-overlay
      (λ (n)
        (square (* (+ n 1) q) "solid"
                (color 0(- 250 (* n q)) 0)))
        count))))

(length (list "Lists can have"
              (list "other" "lists"))
        "as elements"")

(length
  (second
    (list "Lists can have"

 "as elements")))"

(define mymusic
  (list (make-album "The white album" "The Beatles" "Rock")
        (make-album "Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band" "The Beatles" "Rock")
        (make-album "Pod" "The Breeders" "Rock")
        (make-album "Dummy" "Portishead" "Triphop")))

;; Beatles?: album -> Boolean
;; Determines whether an album is by the ;; Beatles

(define (Beatles? album)
  (string=? (album-artist album) "The Beatles"))
  
(check-expect
 (Beatles? (make-album "Title" "The Beatles" "Genre"))
 #true)

(check-expect
  (Beatles? (make-album "Title" "MS MR" "Genre"))
  #false)

;; sum: (listof number) -> number ;; The of the numbers in the list

(define sum
  (λ (lst) (foldl + 0 lst)))

(check-expect (sum (list 1 2 3)) 6)

;; mean: (listof number) -> number
;; The average of the numbers in the list

(define mean
  (λ (lst)
    (⁄ (sum lst)
       (length lst))))

;; square: number -> number
;; The square of a number

(define square
  (λ (n) (* n n)))
    (check-expect (square 2) 4)

;; stdev: (listof number) -> number
;; The standard deviation of the numbers
;; (assuming zero-mean)

(define stdev
  (λ (lst)
    (sqrt (mean (map square lst)))))

(check-expect
  (stdev (list 1 2 3 4 5 6))
  3.8944405226628))

(define (myfoldr proc start list)
  (if (empty? list)
      start
    (proc (first list)
          (myfoldr proc start (rest list)))))

(define (sum-list list partial-sum) 
  (if (empty? list)
      partial-sum
    (sum-list (rest list)
              (+ (first list) partial-sum)))))

(define (foldl proc partial-sum list)
  (if (empty? list)
      partial-sum
   (foldl proc
          (proc (first list) partial-sum))
                (rest list))))

(define (mylength list)
  (local [(define (help list length-so-far)
            (if (empty? list)
                length-so-far
              (help (rest list)
                    (+ length-so-far 1))))]
    (help list 0)))

(define (map proc lst)
  (if (empty? lst)
      (list) 
    (cons (proc (first lst))
          (map proc (rest lst)))))

(define (mylength list)
  (local [(define (loop count rest)
            (if (empty? rest) count
              (loop (+ count 1)
                    (rest rest))))]
    (loop 0 list)))

concepts.Summary: scope example with define value variable and function returning function

concepts.Example code:
(define count 0)

(define (increment!)
  (begin (set! count (+ count 1))
         count))

(define (clear!)
  (begin (set! count 0)
         count))

(define (sum-list lst)
  (local [(define sum 0)
            (define remaining lst)
            (define (loop)
              (if (empty? remaining)
                  sum
               (begin (set! sum
                           (+ sum (first remaining)))
                      (set! remaining
                            (rest remaining))
                      (loop))))]
    (loop)))

(define (sum-list lst)
  (local [(define sum 0)
            (define remaining lst)
            (define (loop)
              (if (empty? remaining)
                  sum
               (begin (set! remaining
                            (rest remaining))
                      (set! sum
                           (+ sum (first remaining)))
                      (loop))))]
    (loop)))

(define (for-each proc lst) 
  (when (not (empty? lst))
    (begin (proc (first lst))
           (for-each proc (rest lst)))))

(define (sum-list lst)
  (local [(define sum 0)]
    (begin (for-each
             (λ (element)
               (set! sum (+ sum element)))
             lst)
           sum)))

concepts.Summary: file-operations: copy-file!, file-exists?, delete-file!, file-or-directory-modify-seconds, rename-file-or-directory!
directory operations: make-directory!, delete-directory!, directory-exists?, directory-subdirectories, directory-files

concepts.Example code:
(define (copy-files! from to)
  (for-each (λ (file)
              (copy-file! file
                          (build-path to
                                      (path-filename file))))
            (directory-files from))))

(define (copy-subtree! from to)
  (begin (unless (directory-exists? to)
           (make-directory! to))
         (for-each (λ (file)
           (copy-file! file
                       (build-path to
                                   (path-filename file))))
           (directory-files from))
        (for-each (λ (subdir)
                    (copy-subtree! subdir
                                   (build-path to
                                               (path-filename subdir))))
                  (directory-subdirectories from))))

concepts.Summary: Dr Racket error output -  expects a number, given a list
error examples: define expected only one expression for the function body, iterated-overlay expects 2 arguments, saw only 1,
common errors: procedure expects N arguments, procedure expected type, expected a function

(define-struct (cat animal) [sleeping-spot]
  #:methods
  (define (feed! c) ...))
  
(define-struct (dog animal) [best-friend]
  #:methods
  (define (feed! d) ...))
  
(define-struct (mouse animal) [hiding-spot]
  #:methods
  (define (feed! m) ...))

(define-struct animal [name weight age]
  #:methods
  (define (feed! a) ...))
  
(define-struct (cat animal) [sleeping-spot]
  #:methods
  (define (feed! c) ...))
  
(define-struct (dog animal) [best-friend]
  #:methods
  (define (feed! d) ...))
  
(define-struct (mouse animal) [hiding-spot])

(define-struct game-object
  [position orientation velocity angular-velocity radius])

(define-struct (player game-object)
  [])
(define-struct (asteroid game-object)
  [])
(define-struct (missile game-object)
  [lifetime])

(define-struct (player game-object) ()
   #:methods
  (define (update! player) ...)
  (define (render player) ...))

(define-struct (asteroid game-object) ()
  #:methods
  (define (update! asteroid) ...)
  (define (render asteroid) ...))

(define-struct (missile game-object) (lifetime)
  #:methods
  (define (update! missile) ...)
  (define (render missile) ...))

(define-struct game-object
  ()
  #:methods
  (define (update! player)
    (void)))
    
(define-struct (player game-object)
  ()
  #:methods
  (define (update! player) ...)
  (define (render player) ...))
  

(define-struct (asteroid game-object)
  ()
  #:methods
  (define (render asteroid) ...))

(define-struct question
  [text answer]
  #:methods
  (define (display q) ...)
  (define (check-answer q response) ...))
  
(define-struct (multiple-choice-question question)
  [number-of-choices choices]
  #:methods
  (define (display mcq) ...))
  
(define-struct (numeric-question question)
  [error-range]
  #:methods
  (define (check-answer nq response) ...))
